top_categories.workout_context: Dirty French rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.

Dirty French’s appalachian foothills gravel - steep sustained climbs, technical terrain, challenging ohio hill country demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Dirty French isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Dirty French when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
At 100 miles, Dirty French punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Dirty French. Make this intensity feel like home.
Dirty French’s 9,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.

Dirty French’s appalachian foothills gravel - steep sustained climbs, technical terrain, challenging ohio hill country and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Dirty French — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.

Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what Dirty French’s appalachian foothills gravel - steep sustained climbs, technical terrain, challenging ohio hill country delivers on race day.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Dirty French’s 9,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Dirty French — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on appalachian foothills gravel - steep sustained climbs, technical terrain, challenging ohio hill country.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Dirty French’s 100 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Dirty French requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on appalachian foothills gravel - steep sustained climbs, technical terrain, challenging ohio hill country to build confidence.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on TT Threshold, Gravel Specific, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 100 miles of appalachian foothills gravel - steep sustained climbs, technical terrain, challenging ohio hill country in Chillicothe, Ohio.
